Course Description: THIS COURSE IS THE FIRST IN THE TWO-COURSE PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING SEQUENCE.  STUDENTS WILL USE TECHNOLOGY TO PREPARE AND USE FINANCIAL INFORMATION.  SPECIFICALLY, STUDENTS WILL STUDY THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE, FINANCIAL STATEMENT PREPARATION, AND TRANSACTIONS CONCERNING CASH, ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, AND INVENTORIES.  THE COURSE FOCUSES ON SERVICE AND MERCHANDISING BUSINESSES OPERATING AS SOLE PROPRIETORSHIPS.  A COMPREHENSIVE PRACTICE SET IS REQUIRED IN THIS COURSE.  NO COURSE  PREREQUISITES, ALTHOUGH IT IS STRONGLY RECOMMENDED THAT STUDENTS COMPLETE CGS1000 OR CGS1101 OR HAVE EQUIVALENT SKILLS.
Textbook(s):
FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, 7TH EDITION, BY NEEDLES AND POWERS. 
COMPUTER ACCOUNTING ESSENTIALS USING QUICKBOOKS FOR THE WEB,  2002E, BY YACHT AND CROSSON
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
